Appeal of C.C., DFRF Supported 
   Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Society of Koreans in Germany for Cooperation made public a statement titled "Unity leads to peace and split to war" on Nov. 28 in full support of the appeal issued by the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of the Fatherland which clarified that the DPRK's war deterrent for self-defence is for freeing the Korean Peninsula from the danger of nuclear war posed by the U.S.
 The statement said that the appeal published when the DPRK is dynamically advancing towards the building of a great prosperous powerful nation after having access to powerful war deterrent taught the Koreans at home and abroad once again that the Korean nation should preserve and materialize the idea of "By our nation itself" enshrined in the June 15 joint declaration in order to achieve the peaceful reunification of the country.    
 It called upon all the Koreans to turn out as one in the struggle to implement the June 15 joint declaration, bearing deep in mind the historical truth that unity leads to peace and split to war when the dawn of national reunification is breaking.

articles.content:
Greetings to Thai King 
   Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Bhumibol Adulyadej, King of Thailand, on Monday on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wished the King good health and happiness and the friendly Thai people prosperity and welfare on the occasion of the king's birthday and the national day of Thailand.
